critique: The document is a formal approval of a code of fair competition for the distilled spirits industry. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and stability in the industry. There is a slight sense of joy that the policy of Congress is being effectuated. There is no indication of sadness, fear, or disgust. There might be a slight sense of surprise that the code has been approved so quickly.
